text:
# 
## Full Document

Department: Underwriting
Document Type: Eligibility & Risk Assessment SOP
Version: 1.0

1. Purpose

To provide standardized rules and assessment criteria for evaluating applicants applying for individual or family health insurance policies.

2. Applicant Eligibility Criteria

Applicant must be 18 to 65 years (entry age).

Family floater eligible dependents include:

Spouse

Children aged 91 days to 25 years

Senior citizen plans require separate underwriting.

3. Decline / Temporary Hold Conditions

Applicants must be declined or placed on hold under the following conditions:

Active cancer diagnosis

Major organ transplant history

Uncontrolled diabetes (HbA1c > 9%)

HIV positive status

Ongoing hospitalization

Recent major surgeries (< 90 days)

4. Medical Evaluation Requirements

Telemedical screening for all applicants > 45 years

Full medical check-up for:

Smokers above age 40

BMI > 32

Family history of cardiovascular disease

Additional tests may be requested based on declared conditions.

5. Final Decision Rules

Underwriters shall use the following categories:

Standard Accept — no loading, no exclusions

Accept with Loading — increased premium due to risk

Accept with Exclusions — specific conditions not covered

Reject — high-risk profiles based on Section 3

# 
## Full Document

Document ID: INS_DOC_002
Department: Claims
Document Type: End-to-End Workflow SOP
Version: 2.1

1. Claim Registration

Customer calls or submits claim online.

Capture:

Policy number

Vehicle details

Date & time of incident

Location & description

Generate Claim Reference Number.

2. Initial Assessment

Verify policy validity

Confirm coverage type (OD / TP / Comprehensive)

Check prior claims history

Identify potential fraud triggers

3. Surveyor Assignment

Assign external surveyor within 24 hours

Provide:

Claim reference

Contact details

Location of vehicle

Garage information

4. Survey & Damage Estimation

Surveyor responsibilities:

Inspect the vehicle

Capture images

Estimate repair cost

Submit detailed survey report

5. Approval & Repair Process

Compare estimate with policy terms

Approve repair amount

Notify customer & authorized garage

Final bill reconciliation

6. Claim Settlement

Collect final invoice

Verify repairs as per surveyor report

Make payment to garage or customer

Close claim in system

# 
## Full Document

Document ID: INS_DOC_003
Department: Fraud Control
Document Type: Red Flag Guidelines
Version: 1.0

1. Purpose

To identify potential fraud indicators in claims or policy applications.

2. Common Fraud Red Flags

Multiple claims within short period

Claim shortly after policy inception

Inconsistency between narrative and evidence

Claimant not reachable or avoids communication

Repaired parts mismatch damage description

Third-party injury claims without police report

3. Document Tampering Indicators

Altered hospital bills

Fake repair invoices

Forged signatures or missing official stamps

Mismatched fonts or numbering

4. Investigation Escalation Rules

Escalate to Fraud Control Team when:

₹50,000 repair claims with inconsistencies

Accident location unverified

Repeated high-value claims

Suspicion of staged accidents or inflated repairs

# 
## Full Document

Document ID: INS_DOC_004
Department: Customer Service
Document Type: Policy Servicing SOP
Version: 3.0

1. Renewal Eligibility Rules

A policy is eligible for renewal when:

Premium is paid before due date

Grace period of 30 days applicable

Renewals beyond 30 days require reinstatement approval

2. Lapsed Policy Restart Process

Validate reason for lapse

Confirm no claims filed during lapsed period

Customer must:

Submit renewal form

Provide self-declaration of good health

For health policies:

Medical underwriting may be required

On approval:

Issue policy with new start date

Apply waiting periods as per norms

3. Customer Communication

Send SMS + Email reminders 15 days before due date

Notify lapse after 30 days

Provide reinstatement options

# 
## Full Document

Document ID: INS_DOC_005
Department: Life Claims
Document Type: Claims Documentation SOP
Version: 1.4

1. Essential Documentation

Required for all life insurance claims:

Original policy document

Claim intimation form

Death certificate (government-issued)

Identity & address proof of claimant

2. Natural Death Requirements

Hospital summary (if applicable)

Doctor’s certificate

Proof of relationship

3. Accidental Death Requirements

FIR copy

Police panchnama

Postmortem report

Accident investigation report

4. Payout Process

Validate documentation

Verify nominee details

Match claim against policy terms

Approve or escalate for investigation

Process payout within 30 working days
